text: {| class="wikitable floatright" style="font-size: 0.9em;" |+ Minor planets discovered: 11 |- | 4490 Bambery || July 14, 1988 || |- | 4954 Eric || September 23, 1990 || |- | (5131) 1990 BG || January 21, 1990 || |- | 5186 Donalu || September 22, 1990 || |- | 5588 Jennabelle || September 23, 1990 || |- | 5620 Jasonwheeler || July 19, 1990 || |- | 12272 Geddylee || September 22, 1990 || |- | 19155 Lifeson || September 22, 1990 || |- | 23469 Neilpeart || September 22, 1990 || |- | || September 23, 1990 || |- | || September 22, 1990 || |- | colspan=3 style="font-size: smaller;" | * co-discovery with Eleanor Helin |} Brian P. Roman is an American astronomer. He has co- discovered the periodic comets 111P/Helin–Roman–Crockett, 117P/Helin–Roman–Alu and 132P/Helin–Roman–Alu. Brian Roman is also credited by the Minor Planet Center with the discovery of 11 minor planet between 1988 and 1990, including 4954 Eric, a near-Earth asteroid of the Apollo group. All of his discoveries were made at Palomar Observatory, where he also participated in the Planet- Crossing Asteroid Survey. The main-belt asteroid 4575 Broman, discovered by American astronomer Eleanor Helin in 1987, was named in his honour. == References == == External links == * Brian Roman, McDonald Observatory Category:American astronomers Category:Discoverers of asteroids Category:Discoveries by Brian P. title: Brian P. Roman
